definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: How many of you believe in psycho-kinesis? Raise my hand.
sentences.chinese: 多少人相信意念驱物的？请把我的手举起来。

sentences.english: One hand went up as the snickering diminished.
sentences.chinese: 有一只手举了起来，同时窃笑声逐渐消失。

sentences.english: Grab two dumbbells of a comfortable weight, and press the weights from your chest upward.
sentences.chinese: 手举适当重量的哑铃，从胸部开始向上举。

sentences.english: Guests will toast the royal couple with sparkling mimosas.
sentences.chinese: 来宾们将手举含羞草香槟为这对新人干杯。

sentences.english: Swim backstroke, focusing on keeping the hands above the shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 游仰泳，专注于保持手举在肩。

sentences.english: Holding the umbrella, can not cover the rain pours, wanton play on the girl.
sentences.chinese: 手举的伞，遮不住雨的倾泻，肆意地打在女孩的身上。

sentences.english: The hero exploded the packet of gunpowder by holding it up.
sentences.chinese: 英雄手举炸药包引爆了炸药。

sentences.english: A gay-rights supporter held a flag during a pride parade in Mumbai Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 一名同性恋权利支持者手举旗帜进行游行，孟买。

sentences.english: Would one of the TAs count, because I don't want to. Just hold your hands up.
sentences.chinese: 助教数一下吧，因为我不想做，保持手举着。

definition: to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
